oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A COASTAL AREA MODEL CONSIDERING SAND NOURISHMENT PROCESS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kuroiwa, Masamitsu
Shibutani, Yoko
Matsubara, Yuhei
Mase, Hajime
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sediment transport
beach nourishment
morphodynamic
numerical model
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents a 3 D morphodynamic model with shoreline change based on quasi-3D nearshore current model. In this model, sand nourishment process with sand dredging and charging was newly considered. First, in order to investigate the performance the present model, it is applied to the prediction of 3D beach evolution with sand bypassing system around a model port and sand recycling system between two groins. Secondly, the developed model was applied to morphodynamics after sand nourishment in a sand recycle project conducted Kaike Coats, Tottori,Japan. Finally, the applicability of the model was investigated and discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; sediment.60
